file_content.text: I... thank you! I won't let you down!
Relieved of duty... what am I going to do now?
Welcome back! I can't thank you enough for all this.
We've got Private Falk in custody now. He'll be under guard until his court martial. I still can't believe it.
I just finished my report to Republic Command. General Ando wanted to speak with you when you returned.
Put the general through; I'll speak with him now.
I'd be honored.
Thank you, Master Jedi. One moment.
Tell the general I'll speak with him now, Lieutenant.
Of course.
Yes, sir. I'll call him at once, sir.
I guess I can spare some time for your general now.
I'm always happy to chat.
Why would General Ando want to talk to me?
What for?
The base wouldn't even be standing if it weren't for you. I think he just wants to thank you.
Fine. Let's get it over with.
Just a moment....
Lieutenant Laskin to Republic Command. General, do you read me?
General Ando here. Ah, these must be the people you spoke of.
Ando here. Ah, you must be the Jedi I've heard so much about.
General Ando here. I don't need to ask who you are, Captain; your reputation has preceded you.
This is Ando. And you must be the spacer that Lieutenant Laskin has been telling me about.
Ando here. I've heard so much about you by now, I wanted to speak with you myself.
On behalf of the entire Republic, I commend you. Your actions have saved countless lives, not only on Hoth, but throughout the galaxy.
Is there anything you'd like to say on this occasion?
The lieutenant held this place together through the worst possible circumstances. He deserves a promotion.
Some praise belongs to Laskin.
That's good advice.
Lieutenant Laskin, you are hereby granted the rank of captain, effective immediately. Keep up the good work.
Thank you, sir! I won't let you down.
If I hadn't come here, Aurek Base would be a smoldering crater. The lieutenant should be stripped of his rank.
Laskin is useless.
I have to admit, it was only good luck that you happened along.
Lieutenant Laskin, you are hereby relieved of duty. You'll be leaving Aurek Base on the next transport. Is that clear?
Yes, sir....
I didn't ask to speak with you solely to offer congratulations, I'm afraid.
We received a garbled transmission from Cresh Outpost. We suspect the signal was being jammed.
The only word we could make out was, "Chiss."
I'd be extremely grateful if you could find Lieutenant Kieral at Senth Outpost.
The base there went silent, and last we knew, they were under heavy fire from pirates.
I'll go there and find out what's happened.
I'll check it out.
You want me to investigate.
I'd like you to report to Admiral Revald. He's commanding the operations in the ship graveyard.
His mission is a matter of utmost secrecy, but if you can assist him, it would bring a major turning point in the war.
I can't just run off without any information.
What is he doing?
I can't risk telling you via holocall; this channel isn't entirely secure. Suffice it to say, this is the most critical operation on Hoth.
I'll go there now.
I know we've asked a lot of you already. I assure you, the Republic knows how much she owes you for this.
Good luck out there. Ando out.
I have business elsewhere at the moment.
The admiral will have to wait.
I understand. Good luck to you, wherever you're headed next. General Ando out.
I hope to see you again. We could certainly use more people like you.
Wait, if you're here... no, don't tell me. If we're about to be blown to smithereens, I think I'd rather not know.
The Crescent Canyon Facility will be heavily defended. Good luck.
If the Talz lose control of the power relay... none of us are going to make it out of here alive.
Sir, a distress flare was just fired from the power relay.
That relay is the only reason we still have shields and heat. If the Talz defending it are being overrun....
Orders, Lieutenant?
I... don't know.
There's no need to panic. I can answer the distress signal.
Stay calm. I'll handle this.
Thank you. I... don't know what we'd do if you weren't here.
Is "Lieutenant" your first name? For an officer, you don't seem to have any leadership skills.
You're completely pathetic.
I... I'm sorry.
Something you need done?
Please, go to the relay. If you can't hold off the Empire... send up a flare. We'll try to evacuate as much of the base as we can.
You made it! Welcome back! With long-range sensors working again, it's starting to look like we might pull through this after all.
You've done us a huge service. The soldiers you rescued came back singing your praises.
Master Jedi, we're honored that you took the time to help us.
Captain, we can't thank you enough for finding our people. This base hasn't had any hope in a while.
It was a lucky day for us when you decided to come to Hoth.
I don't even want to think about what would've happened if you hadn't gone out there.
Those men owe you their lives. Thank you.
Those soldiers didn't run into any Imperials on the way back, did they?
Hope it was an easy trip.
A few more men and an early warning system aren't going to save this base from the Empire.
What are you going to do now?
You are most welcome.
No problem.
I know, I'm amazing.
They were headed for the long-range sensors. Thank you again for doing this. And good luck.
Are you our reinforcements? Thank goodness!
Master Jedi, I can't tell you how glad I am you've arrived.
Captain! Good to see you, sir! We didn't expect reinforcements from Havoc Squad--this is the best news we've had in days.
I can't tell you how happy I am to see just about anyone who's not in an Imperial uniform these days.
I'm glad you made it. I thought for sure the Empire had control of our airspace.
Welcome to Aurek Base--what's left of it. I'm Lieutenant Laskin.
Did Republic Command send you? Did they get my distress signal?
I don't think your signal got through. The station seemed pretty calm.
No one mentioned it.
This doesn't look like enough people to defend a cargo container, let alone a base.
Where is everyone?
What's going on here?
You don't know? If you're not here to answer my distress call... I don't know what we're going to do. We can't hold out much longer.
An explosion in one of the speeder hangars knocked out main power.
Within seconds, we were under heavy Imperial fire. Our shields hadn't switched to auxiliary power yet.
Without the shields, you must have taken heavy casualties.
How serious was the damage?
What you see here, Master Jedi, might be all that's left of the Republic presence in this area of Hoth.
Can this base withstand another attack?
Are the shields holding now?
Shields are at forty percent, Captain. We can take one shot--maybe two--from an ion cannon. I'd give the order to evacuate if I could.
Did you find out what caused the explosion? Or more importantly, who?
Any suspects?
No time to investigate. Everyone who's left is working around the clock to keep our heat and shields running.
Where's the base commander?
As the most senior officer left, I've been trying to contact Republic Command. I don't know what to do here.
This base is just a giant target for another Imperial attack. You should retreat to a safer position.
You need to get out of here.
I know, but I can't order an evacuation while we have people out of communication with the base.
We still have men in the field on a critical mission--or we did when we were attacked, anyway. Between the Imperials and the cold....
I don't have enough people for a search party. Please, if you could head out there... you're their only chance.
What makes you think they haven't already frozen to death?
You think they're alive?
I know it's a long shot, but the mission they were on is vital.
Fine, I'll look for them.
They were headed out to check the long-range sensors. With those running again, we'd have some warning before another attack hit.
If you reach them, give them these--fresh weapons and supplies. Then they might make it back. And thank you.
I don't have time for this now. You'll have to send someone else.
Sorry. [Refuse quest]
I... of course. I understand. Please, if you do find the time for us... we need help.
